question: 丸い
sourceMnemonic: With an <ja>い</ja> on the end, you can guess that this word is an <ja>い</ja>-adjective. What is the adjective version of the kanji <kanji><ja>丸</ja></kanji>? "Circle" becomes <vocabulary>circular</vocabulary>, <vocabulary>spherical</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>round</vocabulary>. This, compared to another similar word (<ja>円</ja>), is more general purpose and can be used with 3D spherical objects as well.
sourceReadingMnemonic: This word uses the reading you learned for the kanji <kanji><ja>丸</ja></kanji>, though you'll need to tack the <ja>い</ja> onto the end too.
